text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a delicious and very green
arugula pesto that's right there's no
basil there's no parmesan but is
unbelievably delicious and has like four
ingredients so check this out so easy to
make bring some salted water to a boil
or a simmer and you're going to throw in
a big handful of arugula now every store
sells bagged picked ready to use arugula
try to find the biggest leaves you can
find the bigger the leave the older the
arugula the older the arugula the
stronger the flavor the more peppery
flavor you're going to get and that's
what you want for a for this kind of a
pesto so we're going to give it a
literally 30 second blanch in the hot
water put it in some ice water wring it
out squeeze it out and you're ready to
go in a blender we're going to add three
or four big cloves of garlic some raw
almonds okay not toasted
raw whole almonds olive oil alright a
nice olive oil and arugula okay now you
want to pulse this on and off for I
don't know ten fifteen seconds then
scrape it down with a spatula and repeat
that a couple times until it's just a
coarse puree do not over blend this do
not just leave it on for you know two
minutes the olive oil gets bitter when
you over blend it all right you kind of
bruise the olive oil with the blender
blade so be careful alright just until
it's a coarse puree you want to kind of
you know chunky and have some texture
alright we're going to add some salt to
taste big pinch of salt taste it adjust
and there you go this is amazing on all
kinds of stuff I particularly love it
with grilled red meat or any red meat or
fish chicken you name it so good super
intense not for the faint of heart this
is a you know punchy right in the face
kind of sauce and the odd thing is
you're gonna think it's got some
parmesan in there there's something
about the raw almond and the sharpness
of the garlic and that little bit of
fattiness from the almond that really
kind of simulates Parmesan very very
interesting anyway super nice easy easy
recipe I hope you give it a try go to
this site all the ingredients are there
of course and as always enjoy
